United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
S.W.C. Africa

L. de R. du Verge
to Dept of State
Washington D.C.
Request for blanks Forms, Flags, Boat, Flag Staff &a
Statement of the conditions in which the Consular archives &a are.

United States Consulate
St Paul de Loanda
June 29th 1882.

The Hon. J. C. Bancroft Davis
Asst. Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I have the honor most respectfully to request that the U.S. Govt. may furnish this consulate with a boat oars and sail. My reasons for asking such are: that a boat here is the most essential piece of furniture this Consulate could have, as to travel by land to the places under this jurisdiction, in a Hammock cost too much, and being a seafearing man, I will be able to manage a boat to any point of my Consular supervision with more speed and less expenses, when such is required for the benefits of Americans and the govt I have the honor to represent here.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
L. de R. du Verge
U.S. Consul
